page.title: 14Change in The Shelsleys
page.content: Since the publication of the{Victoria {County History}a more radical change in the face of the countryside can not have taken place in any other century. Gone are the narrow, dusty lanes and farm workers' cottages. Gone too in the last few years are most of the fruit orchards and hop yards, to be replaced by grazing and arable farming. Small farms have long since been absorbed into greater, and redundant farmhouses converted into elegant dwellings for city commuters. Now only a few men work on the land, and their skills are required for a knowledge of vehicles and machinery as much as husbandry. There appears to be a breakdown in village community life as well. The school closed a decade ago; the parish church is only sparsely attended, and television keeps families at home.
